Reviews.Title: “Not to my Satisfaction”
Reviews.Author: Ricardo G
Reviews.Content: One of the best things that I encountered at this Days Inn was the attentiveness of the front desk staff. From there on it was unsatisfactory for me. The building is detached from the front desk area and is old, has no elevator and not in the best neighborhood. The room that I stayed in was ok and could have been a little cleaner. The bed sheets looked rather worn out, but, the bed was comfortable. The TV is not flat screen and the reception was not all that great. One of the big pluses is that I had a microwave oven and small fridge which came in handy. The A/C is rather noisy, but, works just fine and kept my room comfortable. Would I stay at this hotel again? The answer is no. There are a lot more hotel choices around this area that look more promising although a bit more expensive. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty dingy, and outdated!!”
Reviews.Author: Benique12
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a bad neighborhood, there were hairs on the pillows and sheets, and the entire hotel is outdated and dingy. Definitely would never stay here again, we reserved 3 nights and left after our first.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go”
Reviews.Author: beefnose
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a sketchy neighborhood. There is a mentally ill person who lives in the hotel who hangs out in the hallway asking people for things. He showed up every place we went. Management doesn't seem to care that he bothers other quests. No air conditioning in the hallway. Choose some place else.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away! Very Very Dirty!!”
Reviews.Author: LovePhoenix
Reviews.Content: Horribly dirty! Scary area!! Stay Away!! Very dark and gloomy!! Glass doors have a bar across them and do not work.. Rooms smell, curtains old and smelly, gross carpets just awful!

Reviews.Title: “Just one word will do- BEDBUGS”
Reviews.Author: Tmbwnm
Reviews.Content: A bit run down which is not a big deal to me, but bedbugs and I saw what looked like mouse droppings as well. Not worth the discount.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at any cost”
Reviews.Author: BikeMikeOK
Reviews.Content: No maid service or towel service! No notice of such. Appliances not work. Toilet broke. Phone didn't work. Beds cheap and uncomfortable. Hallway ceiling was moldy and leaking. Continental breakfast---a joke. Rude staff.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid at all costs”
Reviews.Author: STJ061205
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 7-night tour of the West with my 15 - 17 year old Girl Scout troop. We spent our last night in this hotel. Thankfully it was the last night and not the first. We arrived at 10:30pm to check in a group of 44. The girl at the front desk was very nice and efficient. After that things went downhill quickly. The hotel consists of 2 buildings. We were in the second building. I suspect that the few good reviews were from people who stayed in the main building. The 2-story building we stayed in reminded me of something that should have been condemned. When we arrived in 102-degree weather the Air conditioning in the hallways was turned off. We figure no big deal; our rooms will be cool. Well the air conditioning in all the rooms was turned off. This did not make sense, they knew we were coming you would have thought the rooms would be prepared. Some of the rooms never cooled down. I was fortunate that the room I was in did cool down by morning. So I was able to shower comfortably. When walking the halls trying to find our way to the lobby (which you could not get to without leaving the building) to get extra towels we noticed that the steps to the second floor were closed down and blocked off. There was also one room in the hall, which had the yellow and black police caution tape on the door and a boarded up sliding glass door out to the parking lot. Each room had a sliding glass door to the outside. Some of these led to a very unsafe parking lot. Fortunately the student travel company I used provided nighttime security officers. As the other reviews have said the sheets and towels were very dingy and everything was in very poor repair. I would definitely never stay here again and would avoid Days Inns wherever possible. On our tour we stayed at 2 Days Inns and 2 Laquintas. The Days Inns were both awful whereas the Laquintas were fine. Since I did not have control over the hotels I am glad I did not read these reviews beforehand. But if you are considering this hotel I would recommend avoiding it if at all cost. There is a Laquinta across the street, which looked much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “We got exactly what we paid for.”
Reviews.Author: mello1441
Reviews.Content: We booked a trip trough Expedia. We were looking for a buget motel and got exactly that. The rooms were clean, but old. They are in need of a remodel. Our room was on the ground facing the parking lot. There were loud people coming and going all night. The second night there I used the ear plugs I brought with me. The rooms facing the pool were probably more quiet. We had a small kitchen with a fridge, micowave & coffee pot. We didn't know that before we got there. It was a nice suprise. And we used it. The pool area was nice. There were chairs and loungers. The motel is near a McDonald's, Denny's, Arby's & Jack in the Box. Other wise not much else in the area. It was difficult getting across the street to get to the I-17 South exit. Traffic was backed up there frequently. Getting North was not a problem. There is a continential breakfast. There is very little food here. If your hungry go across the street to Denny's otherwise you'll starve. The coffee was good though. For the amount of time we actually spent it the motel it was fine with us.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: SimonSherwoodPark
Reviews.Content: The Days Inn was OK. Before leaving I was a bit woprried by some of thepoor reviews but it was OK for what we expected i.e. a budget hotel. Room was mostly clean, service was friendly, we didn't need to change rooms or anything like that. Not much choice for food unless you are driving. A couple of ast food places within a block along with a 24 hour mini-mart. OK as a place to stop over but I wouldn't stay for days or weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Value Hotel w/ problems”
Reviews.Author: calbears2008
Reviews.Content: This hotel had one of the lowest prices in the Phoenix area and it delivered just about what I expected. The hotel did not receive my internet booking, but honored my rate (twenty dollars below normal price). I had no problems with safety and there was very little nightime noise. The room did have an awful citrus odor that took some time to adjust to and the in-room microwave did not work. I would recommend a nicer hotel, but the price is hard to beat. I did not try the pool, but it always appeared to be clean and frequently occupied. Certainly not the death trap that other reviewers make it out to be.

Reviews.Title: “Turn around and RUN!”
Reviews.Author: nwtravel
Reviews.Content: THIS PLACE IS A SCARY DUMP!!!! Unsafe location, loud all hours of the night, dingy sheets, scalding hot or freezing cold showers, toilet didn't work, and sliding doors on the first floor (can you say "break in?"). We had reservations for 5 nights and only made it through 3. We ate the charges for the last two nights and forked over even more $ to stay at a nicer place. Believe me, it was worth it. Nothing kills a vacation more than seriously considering sleeping in your car because you don't want to go back in your hotel room. The last 2 nights of our trip were HEAVEN because we weren't at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Run Away.......I did”
Reviews.Author: MsTerri
Reviews.Content: I was scheduled to stay at this hotel for three days on a business trip. If I hadn't arrived too late to call the office for a different reservation, I would not have stayed even one night. The sheets didn't look as if they were changed, they were dingy and wrinkled. The carpet had years of ground in dirt, the room smelled odd. The pillow smelled bad. The bathtub had some sort of filler material holding in the overflow drain, and it was rusty. The sink counter was wavy with water damage and patches. This place is about 25 years past a remodel. The only part of it that looked OK was the exterior and lobby. One plus was that the staff was courteous, even when my office called to complain and cancel my next two nights. The staff did what it could with a run down facility...except for those sheets. Never again will I stay at a Days Inn. I've never been in a more run down, ground-in grungy room. It made me feel crawly all over. Oh yes, I used the ancient coffee pot to heat water for tea. Took one mouthful and had to spit it out. It tasted like someone had boiled cabbage in it .

Reviews.Title: “Great Pet Friendly Stay in Phoenix”
Reviews.Author: poodlemom
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 4 days at the Days Inn at I-17 & Thomas in Phoenix. We had a very nice stay and would definitely stay there again. One of the reasons we chose this property is because we received a very good room rate and an extremely reasonable fee for our two tiny dogs. Our pool side room had 2 queen beds, a huge dressing area, and a small kitchenette, as well as the usual amenities - hairdryer, coffee pot, etc. We received excellent service, and all areas were cleaned and maintained daily, including the grounds & pool area. The breakfast was okay, but could have had a bit more in the way of selection. There's a Jack in the Box right next door you can walk to if you want something else for breakfast or don't feel like leaving there.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Smell”
Reviews.Author: bls1997
Reviews.Content: We stayed here March 21, 2007 through March 24. This place is badly in needs of a beauty makeover. The staff is so unfriendly. The halls smell of smoke so bad you are wondering what your non smoking room is going to smell like. We opened the bathroom door on arrival and the smell almost knocked us over. There was no exhaust fan so we plugged the vent near the ceiling with a wash cloth. The ventalation for the building is terrible. We kept the patio door open all night, the fan running, and a candle burning. The smell did die down. The outside maintenance did clean up around the pool area each morning. The continental breakfast is located in a separate building, was okay.

Reviews.Title: “You'll hate it.”
Reviews.Author: Ad_Photog
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel for college guys on their way to Vegas, and no more. No the roof didn't leak, but it's a noisy, smelly dump and no self-respecting business traveler, family or even yougster should consider it. Got fifty bucks? Need a "place to crash?" You'll probably love it, but most of us are done with Days Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service very poor”
Reviews.Author: DenverCOPriscilla
Reviews.Content: Very poor customer service. We tried to get two extra pillows for two days and finally got them before bed on the second night. Front desk girls were rude and did have time for us and no one seemed to be able to open any storage unless maintenance was there at 9 PM. Room is in need of repair as it is an older building. The mattresses were broken down and should have been replaced a long time ago. Maid service was good and the grounds and pool are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not so great..”
Reviews.Author: YourBasicMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights. When we checked in we were given a room on the ground floor parking side. When we got in, I knew I couldn't stay in that room because it was dirty, and I didn't feel safe. Went back to the front desk and demanded something different on the 2nd floor. They gave me a new room, the difference was like night and day. Being on the 2nd floor, there is no traffic into the room from outside through the sliding patio door and the carpeting was cleaner looking. Also I think the difference is the housekeeper and how she maintains her rooms. It was noisy, from the trains nearby and the freeway. I should have paid the extra $40 per night to stay in something better. Furnishings were old, worn, but the beds were nice. If this room was $50/night I would say you get what you pay for. The pool was heated, and the jacuzzi was nice. There were, however, no towels available for the pool. I smoke and I really did like the fact that each room had a balcony. Easy access to the 17 freeway, a couple restaurants within easy walking distance. Surprisingly, our room had soft water.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Place”
Reviews.Author: flawson
Reviews.Content: The people were pleasant at check-in, and the room was clean and cozy. The pool and jacuzzi are very nice. Went skinnydipping in the middle of the day; front desk gave me permission when I asked, and no one seemed to care .. I thought that was pretty cool. I'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches, Electrical Problems, Room Lockouts, Oh My!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't expect much for $50 a night, really, but I did have a few problems with my room. First of all, I entered my room, it was completely dark, I fumbled for the light switch, it didn't work. The light switch, and three different lamps all did not work. I found the light switch in the bathroom, and the first thing I noticed when I turned on the light was a beefy cockroach on his back, legs in the air, wiggling around like a dog wanting his belly scratched. This thing was huge! The inconvenient part was that I stayed for three nights - each day my room key would stop working, and I would have to walk to the office to get it reset- usually it was while I was laying out by the pool, so I'd have to trudge down the hall in my wet shorts and wait in the lobby scaring the poor families checking in who had to look at my hairy back. I asked the front desk clerk is there a problem why this keeps happening, and one of them said "it's because they're cheap!" I assume they meant the owners or management. The pool area wasn't bad, nice and clean, kind of an older place but kept really clean. The furniture, carpets, etc., are pretty old and way outdated, the place could really use a freshening up. I was staying alone, so it wasn't bad. If I would have brought my partner here, he would have divorced me for sure! Or made me find a nice resort hotel with luxury amenities. I survived my stay, I don't think I would ever go back.

Reviews.Title: “A Hotel to be Avoided at All Costs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived on March 5th and discovered the wi-fi Internet did not work in the room which had been booked and pre-paid by my company. I was moved to a room by the freeway where the wi-fi did work, but this move was the beginning of a nightmare which plagued the visit right up until I left the following Thursday. Each day when I returned from meetings my room key had been deactivated, every day. The explanation I heard most frequently was that when I was moved to a different room, the person at the desk had not made the proper entry in the computer. Each day I made an attempt to straighten this out. At one point, I was not in the computer at all. One of the desk clerks, Angel, promised each day to research and fix the problem, but he never did. He kept saying he needed the manger's assistance but that she was sick and in a "hate the world" mood. Minor inconveniences: The room did not have a coffee pot, so when I asked for one I was brought a coffee pot but no coffee. The pot itself had the incorrect lid and had to be manually pressed up against the coffee container to prevent the hot water from building up inside. Since I was not in the computer I did not receive maid service until Wednesday. When I ordered Chinese food, the lady who finally delivered it told me she had been given a card key to get into the building but it did not work. When the room card would not work Wednesday night, I went to the office and asked for someone to explain why it had been deactivated each and every day. At this point I was afraid to leave my room for ice. The sick manager was at the computer that night. Although I was not even speaking to her directly, she interjected the following: "Well, sir, we don't change the codes once we make the card!" After searching long and hard, the only word I can use to describe her tone is this one: hateful. I suppose I should have slept in my car instead of bothering her. If the hotel is not responsible for making sure guests have reliable access to their rooms, who is? The worse worry, however, was that when I checked out none of the people who are familiar with the problem would be working. When I went into the lobby to check, sure enough, only the friendly manager was there and a lady I had never seen before. So I just left... AVOID this facility at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, very clean, great location. Continental breakfast was superb. Overall, an extremely great value.

Reviews.Title: “Not great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The bathroom was clean but the carpets need a serious cleaning. The hotel need some cleaning overall as well. Booked 2 nights but only stayed 1.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been happier”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: a few friends and i went to phoenix for spring training. a lot of places were already booked up and we really didnt want to spend to much. after we have our price confirmed, we were thinking the worst. the weekly rate was so low, we just figured it was going to be terrible. but it turned out great. it was close to highway 17 and 10, so it was very easy to get around. the building is shapped like a square, with the middle open. the pool and hot tub area are in that middle part. so to get to it, you need a hotel key to get access. a few other places we drove by, anyone could just walk up to the pool from the parking lot. we stayed a week, and i cant think of one complaint. if we go back next year, the days inn will be where we stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Shady neighborhood, but well worth the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel relatively late at night and first impressions can definetly be misleading. We arrived late Saturday night, and it appeared that every room was full with people partying and some of them looked rather rough. The hotel itself is not in a very nice part of Phoenix. I wouldn't really recommend walking anywhere around there after dark, but during the day, it should be fine. Inside the hotel is extrememly different from the surrounding elements. The rooms are very spacious, and ours included a small kitchen. The rooms are kept quite clean, although communicating with the hotel staff at times can be a bit difficult. The pool area is very nice. Lined with fruit trees and plants, it makes for a very relaxing atmosphere. If you do happen to stay at the Days, and you feel like wasting an afternoon, try to hook up with the Australian guy, Doc, who lives year round in the hotel. He's a very nice man with lots of great stories, and he's not afraid to play and lose at a little "American" poker. Enjo

HotelInfo.Name: Days Inn I-17 & Thomas
HotelInfo.Address: 2420 West Thomas Rd, Phoenix, AZ 85015
